Title:
Taxonomy and phylogeny of Phylloporia (Hymenochaetales) with
descriptions of three new species from tropical China
Abstract:
Taxonomic studies on Phylloporia were carried out. Three
new species, P. manglietiae, P. pendula and P. pseudopectinata, are
described and illustrated from tropical China. Phylloporia manglietiae
is characterized by triquetrous to ungulate basidiomata, 68 pores per
mm, a monomitic to dimitic hyphal system and broadly ellipsoid
basidiospores (33.5 × 22.5 μm). Phylloporia pendula is diagnostic by
small, imbricate and pendent basidiomata, 79 pores per mm, a dimitic
hyphal system and broadly ellipsoid basidiospores (3.54 ×2.53 μm).
Phylloporia pseudopectinata differs from other species of Phylloporia by
its applanate basidiomata, 89 pores per mm, a dimitic hyphal system and
subglobose basidiospores (33.5 × 23 μm). Phylogenetic analysis based on
sequences from nuc 28S rDNA D1-D2 domains supported the position of the
three new species in Phylloporia. A key to accepted species of
Phylloporia is provided.
